section.title: Introduction
section.p: Distinct from cards, Mingle pages are where anyone can add information on any topic relevant to a community. Mingle pages can be linked to one another to provide structured navigation.

section.title: What's different about Mingle pages
section.p: Like cards, pages are an integral part of Mingle. Both cards and pages have direct access to the underlying data stored in Mingle, so you can easily create and insert graphs, charts and tables derived from live project data in both. (Learn more about Mingle reporting.) You can also link directly to cards from pages (and vice versa), and if you embed a MQL query that returns cards in either a page or card, then you will automatically be able to click through to view and edit any of the cards listed.
The distinguishing feature about pages is that, unlike cards, they can be made into favorites and tabs to allow quick access from the Mingle user interface, the Overview page being one example.

section.title: The Overview tab
section.p: The Overview tab is a predefined page that is always directly accessible from the Mingle user interface, and typically acts as an access page into other linked pages. Mingle supports the creation of charts and tables in pages (as well as cards) that query the Mingle database to display up-to-date project information graphically. The standard project templates generally have some project reporting in the form of charts and tables on the overview tab.
You can take a look at this example project overview page to see how that might look.
